channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Getting to high getting wasp/bees around children, 4th July
item.description:
GL32EZ Sandfield Road. Grass is the highest now we have ever seen it and never was like this when it was with Tewksbury council. Last time this happened but lower Tewksbury said that this was almost to high to cut and had to get other machines in which if they looked at it now it’s far to high for them. Trouble is it’s attracting lots of wasp and things and many children walk along this path and we have a disabled child which walks to car each day pass this. This is the second email now that has been sent bout this and not heard anything. Could we please have someone contact us regarding this please as your map and dates is still dated 2024 so this shows how useless things is. If not we will once again take this further. There is two drains under this lot so we will not be breaking our mowers to do this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Covers, Gratings & Frames problem, 4th July
item.description:
2hr make safe with give and take please place x1 keep right arrow sign plus x2 sandbags plus x1 cone over broken gully (Broken Chamber Cover/Frame)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stop lines have not been replaced, 4th July
item.description:
Bedford Avenue and Cornwall Avenue The stop lines have not been replaced after the resurfacing of the road and the new lines have been put down. Road users come flying out of Cornwall Avenue because they think they have right of way on to Bedford Avenue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Cornwall Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown verge, 4th July
item.description:
Overgrown verge on corner of Stoke road and Cheltenham road. Reduced visibility from Stoke Road for traffic coming along Cheltenham road. Verge has not been cut this year.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Stoke Road, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Flyposted huge banner on railings at junction, 4th July
item.description:
